en.label:
In this survey, you'll experience powerful features such as


  1. Skip Logic
  2. Show/Hide Logic
  3. Validation
  4. Piping Values and
  5. Navigation

These features help you create adaptive, efficient surveys that engage respondents and improve data quality. Let’s dive in and see them in action!
Welcome to Qlarr’s smart flow example survey!

Skip Logic lets your user skip irrelevant questions, based on their responses. It is mostly used to


  1. Capture user consent or to
  2. Disqualify participants who are not part of your target demographics
en.description: An example is skipping questions about a user's pet if they just answered they have no pets

en.label: Do not skip to end page
Skip to end page
This will skip the whole survey to the end page. Note how the button text changes from Next to Submit if chose to skip.
This and the rest of the survey will be hidden if the user clicked Skip to end page
Section 1: Skip Logic – Ask Only What’s Relevant
For single choice questions, you can apply the Skip Logic by clicking on the gear icon ⚙️ that appears above the question on the right.

From this menu, click on Skip Logic, then select the destination question or section you'd like users to jump to based on their chosen response. Let's take the previous question as an example - below is an illustration of how the Skip Logic was set up:
Skip Logic - How To Setup
Show/Hide Logic customizes the survey experience by adjusting the visibility of questions or pages based on responses, language, or mode.
Boring
OK
Good
As an example of show/hide, we will show a customised message based on your response — How do you find our tutorial so far?
Happy to know that 🎉 OK! we'll provide more details.
😰 Got it! You'll get a quick view of the features without getting into setup :)
Hmm, we hope the next features could be of more interest to you!
Section 2: Show/Hide Logic – Tailor Every Step
You can access the Show/Hide controller by clicking on the the gear icon ⚙️ for a page, question or info display.
You can then choose to show or hide the question or page by setting custom conditions based on survey mode (online/offline), language settings, or responses to specific questions.
Show/Hide Logic – How To Setup
Validation ensures every response meets predefined criteria, helping you collect accurate and high-quality data effortlessly.
Let's start simple - with an example of a required question... Please write your name below

content.en: Must be larger than 2 chars (You can customize this error message)
Max. 30 characters (You can customize this error message)
This is required (You can customize this error message)

en.label: Good! A more complex validation is word count
en.description: This question is required and expects a min of 3 and a max of 10 words
en.hint: Please tell us what you think of Qlarr so far

en.label: Not so good
Boring
Useful
Easy to use
Useless
Powerful
You can also validate against options count. How do you find Qlarr so far?
You can also select different format questions like text, number, email, date and time from the menu on the left for simple format validations.
Section 3: Validation – Get the Right Answers, Every Time
To access the validation options, click on the gear icon ⚙️ for any question.
You can choose from a variety of validation options and enforce required fields from that menu.
Validation - How To Setup
Piping values allows you to reference earlier responses from your users into the survey. Checkout the examples below!
Please write your name or any name here:
Hi ﻿{{Q37:Short Text}}﻿﻿👋, nice to meet you... Note how the name change is instantly reflected in this message.
Not so good
Boring
Useful
Easy to use
Useless
Powerful
Piping also works for more than text, like multiple choices - How do you find Qlarr so far?
you described Qlarr as ﻿{{Q40:Icon MCQ}}﻿
Piping Values
Now this one is pretty straightforward, all you need to do is type "@" when writing a question title, and you will get a list of questions to pipe from.
This is how you would pipe the user's name like we did with the previous example:
Piping Values - How To Setup
Navigation settings allow you to control how respondents move through your survey to ensure a smooth and flexible experience - exactly how you want it.
Choose from different Navigation Modes (this survey is on page by page mode) and decide whether respondents can revisit, resume, or jump between sections.
Section 4: Navigation - Guide Your Users Seamlessly
To access Navigation Options, click on the puzzle icon 🧩 at the bottom right of the screen, and select "Theme 🎨" from the menu.

You will find the below menu on the left side of the screen, where you can select other modes like page by page or all in one. You can also adjust the overall survey navigation options and select when to enforce validation rules.
Navigation - How It Works
You could now try the survey without skipping this time
You could now try the survey with a different answer other than "Boring" and note how there are more sections visible on How To implement the features
That's it for Survey Logic!
Mastering Complex Survey Flow & Logic
